By default, Simple Java Mail handles the ultimate connection and sending of emails. However, it is possible to replace this last step by a custom implementation.

The benefit of this is that Simple Java Mail acts as an accelarator, providing thread pool, applying email content-validation, address validations, configuring a {@code Session} instance, producing a {@code MimeMessage}, all with full S/MIME, DKIM support and everything else.

Note: in this mode, proxy support is turned off assuming it is handled by the custom mailer as well. @see MailerGenericBuilder#withCustomMailer(CustomMailer)
